unnormalised: Hey folks! Ever wondered why that hilarious reel of auntyji dancing at a Delhi wedding went absolutely bonkers, clocking millions of views in just a few hours? Or how a simple chai stall in Varanasi suddenly became a must-visit destination thanks to a viral TikTok? That's the magic (and madness!) of virality in the Indian social media space.

unnormalised: Understanding virality isn't an exact science, but following the trends can definitely increase your chances of hitting the jackpot. What works today might be ancient history tomorrow, so staying agile is key. Right now, authenticity is HUGE. People are tired of heavily filtered, overly-produced content. Think more "Gully Boy" vibes and less "Koffee with Karan." Real stories, real people, real problems – that’s what’s resonating.

unnormalised: Ultimately, virality is a fickle mistress. There's no guaranteed formula. But by understanding the trends, embracing authenticity, and keeping your finger on the pulse of Indian social media, you can significantly increase your chances of creating content that goes viral. Good luck, and may your content reach more people than watched the India vs. Pakistan cricket match on 15/08/1947 (well, maybe not *that* many!). Think of the possibilities!
